reviews.review_msg: She is a great prof who is very knowledgeable and passionate about the things she talks about. She does mark a little tougher and there are weekly assignments that are based on the textbook reading. So you cant get away with not buying the textbook. Marking is a little tough because she often looks for very specific answers. But enjoyed the class.

The course is clear, and to the point. However, the midterm and the final had very strict word counts, if you did not define every term you mentioned in your paper, you would penalised, regardless of the short word count.

Just do your weekly readings (revel and tutorial), attend lectures to reinforce ideas from readings, ask ta's and attend de rooij's office hours for questions (but everything is very clear anyways). really nice introduction to politics and political science even if you don't have that much background knowledge. Heavy on writing abilities.

Not sure if if she is to blame or the content itself but this class was extremely boring. Despite being a nice person, Dr. Rooij was still very unapproachable and had strange word count limits on exams and essays, not enough to get your full point across. Then you would lose marks for not adding more info despite the limited word count LOL.
lectures are very boring. doesn't really give clear criteria. not the worst prof but also don't recommend her

As nice as she is, I wouldn't rec Eline. Gives unclear grading criteria and gives worse clarification when asked. Difficult to access outside of class time. Lectures, readings, and course outline all seem very disconnected and only tangentially related. Sucks, cuz I was excited about this class and it ended up being a psych class :/ reading heavy
Eline is such a nice person! she's really approachable and love her students. Even though i didn't learn much from her I still like her personality lol

a good teacher but you can not teach her outside of class, she specifically tells you not to email her and that she will not reply. the tests are small so its hard to gauge whats going to be on them (midterm was 12 mc and 1 essay & final was 30 mc, 2 short answer and 1 essay)

You don't need to come to lecture because all slides are posted online. I wish there were more assignments to be graded not, just 2 exams and a paper. I didn't like how we couldn't email her... we had to email our T.A's and her exams are just lecture key concepts and the essay portion is like comparing systems etc.. But it is still hard
The lectures are word for word out of the textbook which she is the author of. Midterm is straight out of the book as well.

The midterm asked fair questions, but only 10 MC so little mistakes dock you big marks. The final exam was accumulative which was really hard. Rooij doesnt prepare you for final at all. Lectures are boring and she says word for word whats on the text book. Dont reccomond taking this class with her. She posts the slides so no need to go to class
So boring, midterms and exams are hard. Just says everything will be on the exams and isn't specific at all. Do not take this class if you do not need too.

course material is super dry, only 1/4 of the class would still until the end of her lectures. Takes existing marks off of the exam instead of giving you a zero for wrong answers, better to leave things blank if you don't know it. Her notes are not that good so it's good to listen, if you can endure it.

Midterm was short and very easy, just memorize the key terms in her slides. She is hard to understand but her slides are online and also come directly from the textbook. Tutorials are beneficial. Dr de Rooij is not really that bad and is tolerable in lectures. She and her TAs are helpful. I wouldn't let her rate my prof deter you from her class.

This class is hard because the prof doesn't know how to use her microphone and no matter where you sit, you won't be able to understand because she mumbles and has a thick accent. Everyone leaves the lecture halfway because everything in lectures is in your $125 textbook. The only time I need the textbook is before the exams. The midterm was easy.

The professor was kind and helpful when I visited her during her office hours. Her tests were reasonable and overall, a surprisingly pleasant experience despite not being familiar with political science. I recommend Bella Aung for the TA as she was generous with tutorial participation and was always available for help when needed.
I found her lectures to be quite engaging. She made the material interesting and the tests were not hard. The tutorials were not so good, though. They were very disorganized.

Prof mumbles in lecture and goes way too fast with her slides but does post slides online after the lecture. Did not like her energy or lectures, however, her exams are fair and easy if you understand the terms.
Boring prof. Lectures are useless because she repeats exactly what's in her textbook. Not a difficult class though, just make sure you memorize the terms and you're gucci. P.S. chilli chilli chilli.

She's okay. She's material oriented and basically it's up to you to learn on your own. Not much is taught in the actual lecture, it's more a set of philosophical questions related to the reading. She's not very student-friendly imo; one is not meant to email her under ANY circumstances.. really? What kind of message does that send to students
De Rooij's pop quizzes in this class will be your cause of death.

Very fair prof, not good or bad. She posts her notes online and has super easy exams (as long as you study and understand the terms, you pass the class for sure). The hardest part of the course is participation in tutorials and units readings etc. but very fair and interesting class.

Easy enough class. Posts slides online. Didn't read the textbook and still did well on the midterm and final. Midterm: 10 MC and essay, final: 12 MC, 1 SA, 1 essay. Both were short and very fair. Paper was marked quite hard but i had a terrible TA so that may vary depending on the TA. Tutorial participation is 15%, so go to tutorial and speak up!

She is a good prof. Grading in the essay section of the exam is a bit iffy. Even if you make valid arguments, if they are not part of the list of arguments she gave the TAs you won't get the mark. Her textbook is also full of typos which is extremely frustrating to read. With that said, she is still better than most other profs out there.

I took POL 101W as a last minute elective and I honestly didn't think I would like it... but it was great!!! I learned a lot from Eline, and she had really informative, and high-energy lectures! The course is pretty easy, especially the midterm, and the TA's were very helpful with the final paper. I really recommend this class!
Great prof! Straightforward, everything you needed to know was either in lecture slides or the textbook.
Great professor who really tries to lay down the foundations for a political science education. The course material can be dry at times but that's just because it is an introductory class.

great prof! easiest course i've ever taken. midterm and final were piece of cake. essay required some effort (obviously). lectures are interesting and she tries to maintain attention with several discussions on various topics. tutorial participation is key. lecture attendance will suffice for exam, textbook content is all covered in lecture.

She might come across as a bit strict but as long as you're not a terrible student you won't have problems. Her lectures were clear and easy to follow, and she'd often make them a bit more interesting by provoking some discussion. The slides were always posted online, and the workload/readings were fair. Good prof all around.

Extremely organized and prepared professor but she is a hard marker! You need to attend all of the lectures and anything she says is fair game for an exam. That being said, she was extremely straight forward with what she was expecting.
Her lectures are boring and dry. Midterms and exams are based on memorizing the texbook and leave no room for your own interpretation of course concepts.  However, she is very organized and clear.

Shes a nice teacher, however her expectations for a first year class are a little excessive. Final is cumulative and there is an abundant of information and terms to learn, for only 10 multiple choice questions and an essay. Participation in tutorials are key.

She's my favorite! She is very approachable and positive. She isn't too tough on her students but because she is passionate about her stuff I find you need to be at the best of your game to get the B+ or A's on your writing.

A very wonderful lecturer. Clear, concise, and to the point. Her assignments are fair as are the exams. She always seems on top of her lecture and never lost or confused. Very helpful afterwards if you need it. Overall not difficult as long as you put in the work.

Make sure to be prepared for each class, she doesn't look to give you the grade - you have to earn it. Very knowledgeable and passionate about the class topic, but again, you can't expect to get any default points with no concentrated effort.

A bit unclear about how to structure quantitative papers but probably just because she hadn't taught the class before. Very smart and very helpful, always had time for students even if it meant staying late or running around the tutorial like a crazy person. Only way to make class better would be to use more real life examples to explain concepts.
Attractive, fair, and extremely nice overall.  Bottomline... knows her stuff.  What more do you want in a prof? Would definitely take another class with her again.
Her exams are fair, all the materials are covered in the lecture. Just listen in class and you will be fine.

I took 2 upper division courses with Eline. She is very dedicated to her work and knows her stuff. She definitely is helpful and a  kind person. The amount of course work was fair--it wasn't a class you can sleep through but it wasn't very hard either. Would highly highly recommend her!!

She is extremely nice and helpful. I would totally recommend her to anyone!! She is not hard at all and you will walk away learning something new. Took 2 classes with her so far, looking to take many many more!
